title: When you first started playing the game, and had no idea what the terminology meant
body:
But you tried to speak it anyway
https://m.popkey.co/2b2cd1/3D0eq.gif
I remember calling "Jungle" because while I mainly farmed mid lane, I would roam a lot and got kills in the jungle. And it took me *way* too long to figure out what an ADC was.

replies.body:
I've been playing for years and i still dont know what this myth of a KS is. 

It has to really exist tho because I see it all the time. Last time I was accused of it was during a 5v5 teamfight at the Baron pit.

I had to apologize to the guy...I surely didnt mean to kill the guy that the other 4 members of my team was also attacking.

Ill have to do more research on this wonderful mythical term KS.

I know what a KS is:
http://st.elohell.net/public/chill/d5cec2503af41aa67d882b525b8a5b20.gif
lol

> [{quoted}](name=jjackson5150,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=OW5nNEdR,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-05-26T14:03:55.433+0000)
>
> I've been playing for years and i still dont know what this myth of a KS is. 
> 
> It has to really exist tho because I see it all the time. Last time I was accused of it was during a 5v5 teamfight at the Baron pit.
> 
> I had to apologize to the guy...I surely didnt mean to kill the guy that the other 4 members of my team was also attacking.
> 
> Ill have to do more research on this wonderful mythical term KS.

That reminds me of when I was a support main, and thought "ks" stood for "kinda sweet". People would say that all the time, and I'd usually respond with "yeah, it definitely is", much to the chagrin of my other teammates...

http://i.makeagif.com/media/8-11-2015/MrlcQH.gif

All lanes are singed's

That is actually true. Singed does whatever the hell he wants.
http://orig12.deviantart.net/4567/f/2012/150/2/3/singed_flip_gif_by_artviajesse-d51npus.gif
except when he lanes top vs a diana XD

I'll never forget the first time I did drafted...

"UHHH.... UHHHHHHHH...... WHAT THE HELL DO I DO???"
I remember the first time someone wanted to trade. I thought he meant positions, and got angry because he stole my champion.
The first time I did draft I was the team captain and had to ban people so I just clicked on three random characters.{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}
"What do you mean by CS?"
That one took me an embarrassingly long time to figure out. I used to think it was "Champion Score"

uhhh... yeah, of course it's not Champion score, lol noob! XD



_...what is it? I don't know guys_ **PLS HELP**
creep score, a term from DotA's creeps

{{champion:32}} :drag 1512

{{champion:268}} :mf f 510

{{champion:105}} :Wraiths camp gone gg

{{champion:420}} Mid or **Feed**

{{champion:20}} Mid or **Disco Nunu**



Me:  <_____<
.>__>

Ok..<____>?????

G_G

I used to think lane "Camping" was just another fancy word for duo lane..untill one time i took support {{champion:37}} top and my team got angry at me.

"Wait, why do you want a leash? You're not even a dog character."

- Me in the beginning
LOL

I remember asking my friend what adc is, I don't remember his exact respond, but somehow I started thinking that there are two junglers, and adc is the one in the bottom map area, so I had about 8 games of someone else calling jungle, followed by an "ok imma adc" respond by me, just to insta lock jungle and stupidily farm the bottom area jungle while being flamed by my entire team.

That's me now. Thankfully my fiance and son help me..I have no fucking idea what I'm doing. I basically play support with whatever champ I play ({{champion:3}} {{champion:56}} {{champion:110}}  mostly) , stay in bots and apologize like a Canadian.
For the first two months I played I got sad whenever I saw "nj" because i thought it meant "noob job" and that I had messed up somehow :(
nj isn't even exclusive to league...
When I first started, whenever someone would call bot, i thought they were calling someone a bot, when they were actually going bot lane.

I remember when i started this game I did {{champion:11}} {{item:1038}} {{item:3101}} {{item:3075}} {{item:3006}} {{item:3748}}  every game. I got my first and only penta playing this. I can't remember what the last item was though. 

Edit: I just looked at the game where i got the penta and it was this: http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1959063036/230343476?tab=overview
Wat that's pretty recent if you had Titanic
Yeah it would have been last august i think. I have not been playing for too long.

I came from Dota 2 and they use very different terminology, like safe lane or suicide lane (the lane closest to turret and farthest from it respectively) Carries go into the jungle and afk farm for most of the game. The most confusing thing was CS. Dota has creeps, but league has minions? "What could the C stand for? Creeps make the most sense but I was specifically told these were MINIONS, not creeps. Oh here's the minion score! Wow I have 325 already I must be great at farming!" Now I loathe 325 ms.

I play LoL a little over a year now and I still hear new terminology... Only about two month ago I heared "Turtle it" for the first time, when I played with some guys from gold and plat.
"Open mid" was a new one too
and 'ff' is new too i think?
Open mid is somewhat new to me, and I've been playing since 2012. I immediately understood when someone said it, but i didn't realize it was a used term
its common in higher elo, when teams know they are fkd and just want the game to end

Im in plat (idk what you call higher elo) and even then I've only seen it recently, like 8 months now at most, after 3-4 years its odd. I also don't really like the concept, because the game aint decided at 10 minutes
i dont have faith in comebacks if i see an hypercarry snowballing and my team cant stop it or a bot lane rotating and taking every single objective, but thats just me

I have been playing since late 2011, and FF has always meant surrender becuase the way to start a surrender was /ff  and it also stands for forfeit.  I have never seen and have no idea what Turtle It means.
Play defensively and farm.
There ya have it
ff, or forfeit, has been around atleast since season one I think.
ff = forfeit. you can type /ff to start a forfeit vote also.
I played during a time where there was no terminology...

when i started, duo top was normal and we'd dodge if someone wanted to be jungler, 1v2 top is a nightmare. 

then wriggles lantern and mardred's bloodrazor became more popular and junglers were more accepted than ever

{{summoner:2}} was used in enemy's team fountain to know who's going where, LOL

#throwback 
to a time where all champions where mages and had ap scaling.
Most people still don't know what "BM" means. I see this used out of context so much my liver has started failing because of it.

What do you mean I shouldn't be building a {{item:3074}} on {{champion:19}} ?
''Proceeds to keep toggling E on and of, thinking it's a normal spell with no cooldown that gives you MS''
I had no idea what a gank was, and was just a 12 year old way to say flank, like turrent

I'm still trying to figure out if we are calling trolls who feed the AI on purpose (i.e. people who spend the whole game aa'ing the enemy under the enemy tower as {{champion:45}}, likely in an already occupied lane and never build anything more than {{item:1027}} and {{item:2003}}  )  in the Co-Op mode "Bots" or "IP farmers" .--.
When I started playing league I had a friend named Mia, when my friend told me to call mia after getting ganked by a roam, I was like "Mia? you know mia? How did you get her number?"
It took me the longest time to understand what on-hit effects were{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

I used to think FFS meant *forfeits*

I was wrong.
I used to think cs meant counter strike lol
